entry.title: recorded the song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rachelle Ann Go (pictured) recorded the song "First Burn" with four other actresses who played Eliza Schuyler to promote the music collection Hamildrops?

entry.title: Arch Wolfe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of Arch Wolfe's duties as an NFL general manager was to prevent his players from fighting the referees?

entry.title: Frick Collection (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Frick Collection is not allowed to lend out some of its art?

entry.title: Ash Ketchum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the constant losses of Pokémon series protagonist Ash Ketchum have been highlighted for teaching positive lessons to viewers?

entry.title: Beaumont Society (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Chevalier d'Eon de Beaumont inspired the name of the transgender rights organisation the Beaumont Society?

entry.title: Nils Elias Anckers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nils Elias Anckers was a kommendör in the Swedish Navy who won a silver medal at the 1900 Paris Exposition for his artwork?

entry.title: Mānuka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the canoe Mānuka is said to have voyaged to the Polynesian homeland and brought back tubers that would not grow?

entry.title: Esther Merle Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Esther Merle Jackson, as a specialist in theatre and dance education at the United States Office of Education, intended to expand theater's role in the Great Society?

entry.title: a dispute over 600 machine guns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a dispute over 600 machine guns led Czechoslovakia and Portugal to break off diplomatic relations for nearly 37 years?
